summary: Internal Deutsche Bank email from Parvin Moyne discussing the bank's internal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's accounts, including plans to contact former employees like Paul Morris. The email is sent to Thomas Moyer and Joseph DiPiero.

persons.name: Parvin Moyne
persons.context: Author of the email, discussing Deutsche Bank's internal investigation into Epstein's accounts and planning to contact former employees.

persons.name: Thomas Moyer
persons.context: Recipient of the email regarding Deutsche Bank's internal investigation into Epstein's accounts.

persons.name: Joseph DiPiero
persons.context: Recipient of the email regarding Deutsche Bank's internal investigation into Epstein's accounts.

persons.name: Paul Morris
persons.context: Former Deutsche Bank employee whom the bank's internal investigation plans to contact regarding Epstein's accounts.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of Deutsche Bank's internal investigation regarding his accounts at the bank.

connections.description: Colleagues at Deutsche Bank communicating about an internal investigation.
Colleagues at Deutsche Bank communicating about an internal investigation.
Moyne is planning to reach out to former employee Morris as part of the bank's internal investigation.
Morris was a former Deutsche Bank employee who may have had knowledge of or involvement with Epstein's accounts.

events.title: Deutsche Bank internal investigation email
events.description: Parvin Moyne sends an email discussing plans to contact former Deutsche Bank employees, including Paul Morris, as part of the bank's internal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's accounts.

keyFacts: Deutsche Bank was conducting an internal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's accounts in November 2019.
The investigation planned to reach out to former Deutsche Bank employees, including Paul Morris, for information.
The email shows internal bank communication regarding the Epstein investigation between Parvin Moyne, Thomas Moyer, and Joseph DiPiero.
